activities.name: Stronges Earthquate in U.S. History - rocks Alaska
activities.desc: The strongest earthquake in American history, measuring 9.2 on the Richter scale, slams southern Alaska, creating a deadly tsunami. Some 131 people were killed and thousands injured

activities.name: China Joins A-bomb clud
activities.desc: The People’s Republic of China joins the rank of nations with atomic bomb capability, after a successful nuclear test on October 16, 1964.

activities.name: China Joins A-bomb clud
activities.desc: The People’s Republic of China joins the rank of nations with atomic bomb capability, after a successful nuclear test on October 16, 1964.

activities.name: Vietnam war update
activities.desc: In Paris, a Communist delegation rejects U.S. President Richard Nixon's peace proposal as a maneuver to deceive world opinion.

activities.name: Vietnam Worst Monsoon
activities.desc: In Vietnam, the worst monsoon to hit the area in six years causes large floods, kills 500,000 people and leaves 200,000 homeless and virtually halts the Vietnam War.

activities.name: 1970 Bhola KIller cyclone
activities.desc: The 1970 Bhola cyclone makes landfall in modern-day Bangladesh around high tide, causing $86.4 million in damage (1970 USD, $576 million 2020 USD) and becomes the world's deadliest storm killing over 500,000 people

activities.name: US performs nuclear test at Nevada Test Site
Earthquake hits Fruili area,Italy
activities.desc: killed more than 900 people and making another 100,000 homeless.

activities.name: Killer Algarrobo earthquake
activities.desc: 8.0 Mw Algarrobo earthquake hits Santiago and Valparaíso, Chile, leaving 177 dead, 2,575 injured, 142,489 houses destroyed, and approximately a million people homeless

activities.name: Earthquake Destroys Mexico
activities.desc: An 8.0 Mw earthquake strikes Mexico City, killing between 5,000 and 45,000 people and injuring 30,000 more
